Author: bleepbloophumanoid
Text: Maybe try bringing some of your own foods? Like a healthy veggie dish. Fill up on that, and then just pick at the rest. Also, as long as you plan ahead before and after any family meals (e.g. have a small breakfast, go for a run), those meals wonâ€™t undue your progress.

Author: tomatoterror
Text: I don't know what your family life is like, but my partner and I both have divorced parents so we go to several dinners each holiday. At each one I'll just pick the couple things I want then have to "save room" for the other parties, or I'm "already so full" from the previous ones. It's been amazing actually and I've gotten so much better at declining food I don't want.   Personally I still eat a lot on those days but at least I don't have several full plates plus desserts to fend off.
